As the Supreme Court gets ready to rule on a direct challenge to Roe v. Wade, attacks like these are deeply troubling.

I will keep fighting to protect access to safe, affordable health care and Granite Staters' right to choose if and when to start a family.

But across the country, including in NH, Republican-led legislatures are restricting access to reproductive health care. From passing the first abortion ban in modern history to defunding family planning clinics, NH Republicans are setting the Granite State back decades.

The right to abortion and contraception is a matter of personal autonomy, economic freedom, and health. For 49 years, Roe v. Wade has protected Americans' constitutional right to make their own health care decisions, and we must continue to defend this critical precedent.

After politicians in Concord defunded Planned Parenthood, I pushed the Biden Administration to provide urgently needed funding. Today, we announced that @ppnnehealth will get $500K in federal funding to protect access to high-quality reproductive health care.

Starting next week, N95 masks will be available for free at local pharmacies and health centers. As COVID-19 continues to spread, masks are vital to protecting yourself and your community.
